articles.description: Luis Diaz comes off the bench to salvage a point for Liverpool with a stoppage-time goal on his Premier League return at Luton.
articles.title: Diaz dedicates crucial late Liverpool goal to dad

articles.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen takes a controlled victory in the Sao Paulo Grand Prix to extend his record for wins in a season to 17.
articles.title: Verstappen wins in Sao Paulo from Norris

articles.description: In Kolkata, the City of Joy, the whole of India celebrated Virat Kohli's birthday, his record-equalling one-day hundred and another stop on their march towards glory.
articles.title: 'Kohli the one-day king and king for one day'

articles.description: Manchester City manager Gareth Taylor accuses Arsenal boss Jonas Eidevall of "bullying" the fourth official during their WSL match on Sunday.
articles.title: Arsenal boss bullied official, says Man City manager

articles.description: Colombian-born Liverpool footballer Luis Díaz begs for his father's kidnappers to free him immediately.
articles.title: Footballer Díaz begs father's ELN kidnappers to free him

articles.description: Captain James Tavernier scores twice as Rangers eased past Hearts to book a Viaplay Cup final date against Aberdeen on 17 December.
articles.title: Rangers sweep aside Hearts to set up Aberdeen final

articles.description: Cray Valley Paper Mills bridge a 117-place gap to earn a replay at League One side Charlton Athletic in the first round of the FA Cup.
articles.title: Tier-eight Cray Valley force replay with Charlton

articles.description: Rachel Williams scores a stoppage-time equaliser to earn a dramatic point against Brighton in the Women's Super League.
articles.title: Late Williams goal earns Man Utd draw at Brighton

articles.description: Novak Djokovic wins a record-extending seventh Paris Masters trophy and 40th Masters title in total with a 6-4 6-3 victory over Grigor Dimitrov.
articles.title: Djokovic wins 40th Masters title in Paris

articles.description: Mercedes' Sao Paulo Grand Prix performance was their "worst weekend in 13 years", says team principal Toto Wolff.
articles.title: Sao Paulo GP Mercedes' 'worst weekend in 13 years'
